revised_title: Inositol Lipids and Transmembrane Signaling: The Role of Inositol Trisphosphate in Calcium Release in Limulus Photoreceptors
tldr: The study investigates the role of inositol trisphosphate (InsP3) in the release of calcium ions in Limulus photoreceptors. It shows that only the endoplasmic reticulum in the light-sensitive region of the cell is sensitive to InsP3, and the release of calcium is controlled by a negative feedback mechanism. This feedback contributes to sensory adaptation in the photoreceptor and may explain oscillatory membrane responses observed with large injections of InsP3.
